info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 8:44PM CDT until May 30 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...
Mud Creek Near Jacksonville affecting Smith, Rusk and Cherokee Counties.
For the Mud Creek...including Jacksonville...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mud Creek near Jacksonville.
* WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon to late Thursday night.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 9.8 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.8 feet on 04/10/1942. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: https://water.noaa.gov/wfo/SHV
The next statement will be issued Tuesday evening at 845 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE THURSDAY NIGHT

area.areaDesc: Cherokee, TX; Rusk, TX; Smith, TX
